modules.title: Lines vs Candles
modules.description: Understand the difference between line charts and candlestick charts. Why candles reveal more information.

lessons.title: Chart Types Explained
lessons.content:
**Line Charts vs Candlestick Charts**

**Line Charts:**
â€¢ Simple price representation
â€¢ Shows closing prices over time
â€¢ Easy to read and understand
â€¢ Good for long-term trends
â€¢ Limited information density

**Candlestick Charts:**
â€¢ Rich price information
â€¢ Shows open, high, low, close (OHLC)
â€¢ Reveals market sentiment
â€¢ Better for short-term analysis
â€¢ More complex but more informative

**Why Candles Matter:**
â€¢ **Price Action**: Shows how price moved during the period
â€¢ **Market Sentiment**: Reveals buyer vs seller dominance
â€¢ **Volatility**: Shows the range of price movement
â€¢ **Pattern Recognition**: Enables technical analysis
â€¢ **Decision Making**: Better data for trading decisions

**Key Differences:**
â€¢ **Line Charts**: Only closing prices
â€¢ **Candles**: Full price range for each period
â€¢ **Information**: Candles show 4x more data
â€¢ **Analysis**: Candles enable pattern recognition
â€¢ **Trading**: Candles better for entry/exit timing

**When to Use Each:**
â€¢ **Line Charts**: Long-term trend analysis
â€¢ **Candles**: Short-term trading decisions
â€¢ **Line Charts**: Simple price tracking
â€¢ **Candles**: Technical analysis and patterns

modules.title: Candle Anatomy
modules.description: Open, Close, High, Low â€“ the four points of a candle and how to read their meaning.

lessons.title: Understanding OHLC
lessons.content:
**OHLC = Open, High, Low, Close**

**The Four Points of a Candle:**

**Open (O):**
â€¢ Price when the period started
â€¢ Top of body for bearish candles
â€¢ Bottom of body for bullish candles
â€¢ Shows where trading began

**High (H):**
â€¢ Highest price reached during period
â€¢ Top of the upper wick/shadow
â€¢ Shows maximum buying pressure
â€¢ Indicates resistance level

**Low (L):**
â€¢ Lowest price reached during period
â€¢ Bottom of the lower wick/shadow
â€¢ Shows maximum selling pressure
â€¢ Indicates support level

**Close (C):**
â€¢ Price when the period ended
â€¢ Bottom of body for bearish candles
â€¢ Top of body for bullish candles
â€¢ Most important price point

**Candle Body:**
â€¢ **Bullish (Green)**: Close > Open
â€¢ **Bearish (Red)**: Close < Open
â€¢ **Doji**: Close â‰ˆ Open (neutral)
â€¢ **Body Size**: Shows conviction

**Candle Wicks/Shadows:**
â€¢ **Upper Wick**: High to body
â€¢ **Lower Wick**: Low to body
â€¢ **Long Wicks**: High volatility
â€¢ **Short Wicks**: Low volatility

lessons.title: Reading Candle Patterns
lessons.content:
**Common Candle Patterns:**

**Bullish Patterns:**
â€¢ **Hammer**: Long lower wick, small body
â€¢ **Doji**: Open and close are equal
â€¢ **Engulfing**: Current candle engulfs previous
â€¢ **Morning Star**: Three-candle reversal pattern

**Bearish Patterns:**
â€¢ **Shooting Star**: Long upper wick, small body
â€¢ **Hanging Man**: Similar to hammer but bearish
â€¢ **Evening Star**: Three-candle reversal pattern
â€¢ **Dark Cloud Cover**: Bearish engulfing pattern

**Neutral Patterns:**
â€¢ **Doji**: Open equals close
â€¢ **Spinning Top**: Small body, long wicks
â€¢ **High Wave**: Very long wicks, small body

**What to Look For:**
â€¢ **Body Size**: Large body = strong move
â€¢ **Wick Length**: Long wicks = rejection
â€¢ **Color**: Green = bullish, Red = bearish
â€¢ **Position**: Where in the trend?
â€¢ **Volume**: Confirms the pattern

**Pro Tips:**
â€¢ Don't trade patterns in isolation
â€¢ Consider the overall trend
â€¢ Look for confirmation signals
â€¢ Use multiple timeframes
â€¢ Practice pattern recognition

modules.title: What Is a Trend?
modules.description: Higher highs, lower lows, and sideways action. Learn how to spot trend direction and exhaustion.

lessons.title: Trend Basics
lessons.content:
**What is a Trend?**
A trend is the general direction in which a market is moving over time.

**Three Types of Trends:**

**1. Uptrend (Bullish):**
â€¢ **Higher Highs**: Each peak is higher than the last
â€¢ **Higher Lows**: Each trough is higher than the last
â€¢ **Price Action**: Generally moving upward
â€¢ **Momentum**: Strong buying pressure
â€¢ **Psychology**: Optimistic market sentiment

**2. Downtrend (Bearish):**
â€¢ **Lower Highs**: Each peak is lower than the last
â€¢ **Lower Lows**: Each trough is lower than the last
â€¢ **Price Action**: Generally moving downward
â€¢ **Momentum**: Strong selling pressure
â€¢ **Psychology**: Pessimistic market sentiment

**3. Sideways (Consolidation):**
â€¢ **No Clear Direction**: Price moves sideways
â€¢ **Range-Bound**: Price stays within a range
â€¢ **Low Volatility**: Minimal price movement
â€¢ **Accumulation/Distribution**: Smart money positioning
â€¢ **Breakout Potential**: Often precedes big moves

**Trend Characteristics:**
â€¢ **Duration**: Short-term, medium-term, long-term
â€¢ **Strength**: Strong, weak, or neutral
â€¢ **Momentum**: Accelerating or decelerating
â€¢ **Volume**: Confirms trend strength
â€¢ **Support/Resistance**: Key levels to watch

lessons.title: Trend Analysis Techniques
lessons.content:
**How to Identify Trends:**

**Visual Analysis:**
â€¢ **Higher Highs/Lows**: Draw lines connecting peaks/troughs
â€¢ **Price Action**: Overall direction of movement
â€¢ **Candle Patterns**: Bullish vs bearish candles
â€¢ **Volume**: Confirms trend strength
â€¢ **Momentum**: Rate of price change

**Technical Tools:**
â€¢ **Moving Averages**: Price relative to MA
â€¢ **Trend Lines**: Connect highs or lows
â€¢ **Support/Resistance**: Key price levels
â€¢ **RSI**: Momentum indicator
â€¢ **MACD**: Trend following indicator

**Trend Exhaustion Signs:**
â€¢ **Divergence**: Price vs indicator disagreement
â€¢ **Volume Decline**: Less participation
â€¢ **Pattern Completion**: Technical patterns finish
â€¢ **Overbought/Oversold**: Extreme readings
â€¢ **Parabolic Moves**: Unsustainable acceleration

**Trend Reversal Signals:**
â€¢ **Break of Trend Line**: Price breaks support/resistance
â€¢ **Pattern Completion**: Reversal patterns finish
â€¢ **Volume Spike**: High volume on break
â€¢ **Momentum Shift**: Indicators change direction
â€¢ **News/Events**: Fundamental catalysts

**Pro Tips:**
â€¢ Always trade with the trend
â€¢ Don't fight the trend
â€¢ Use multiple timeframes
â€¢ Wait for confirmation
â€¢ Manage your risk

lessons.title: Drawing Basic Lines
lessons.content:
**Essential Drawing Tools:**

**Trend Lines:**
â€¢ **Uptrend**: Connect higher lows
â€¢ **Downtrend**: Connect lower highs
â€¢ **Horizontal**: Connect equal highs/lows
â€¢ **Use**: Identify trend direction and support/resistance

**Support and Resistance:**
â€¢ **Support**: Price level where buying occurs
â€¢ **Resistance**: Price level where selling occurs
â€¢ **Drawing**: Connect multiple touches of same level
â€¢ **Use**: Identify key price levels

**Fibonacci Retracements:**
â€¢ **Tool**: Automatic retracement levels
â€¢ **Levels**: 23.6%, 38.2%, 50%, 61.8%
â€¢ **Use**: Predict pullback targets
â€¢ **Application**: Draw from swing high to low

**Channels:**
â€¢ **Parallel Lines**: Upper and lower boundaries
â€¢ **Ascending**: Higher highs and higher lows
â€¢ **Descending**: Lower highs and lower lows
â€¢ **Use**: Identify trading ranges

**Pro Tips:**
â€¢ Keep lines simple and clean
â€¢ Don't force lines to fit
â€¢ Use multiple timeframes
â€¢ Confirm with volume
â€¢ Practice regularly

**Common Mistakes:**
â€¢ Too many lines on chart
â€¢ Forcing lines through data
â€¢ Ignoring volume
â€¢ Not updating lines
â€¢ Overcomplicating analysis
